data.author: Aeschylus

data.quote: Trust in Allah  but tie your camel first.
data.author: Arab proverb

data.quote: It is vain to ask of the gods what man is capable of supplying for himself.
data.author: Epicurus

data.quote: Heaven ne'er helps the men who will not act.
data.author: Sophocles

data.quote: To give pleasure to a single heart by a single kind act is better than a thousand head-bowings in prayer.
data.author: Sa'di

data.quote: Always look for ways to act upon the faith you display in your prayers.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: You can do more than pray after you have prayed  but you cannot do more than pray until you have prayed.
data.author: A. J. Gordon

data.quote: Visualize  "prayerize " "actionize " and your wishes will come true.
data.author: Charles L. Allen

data.quote: There is a time for all things  a time to preach and a time to pray  but those times have passed away  there is a time to fight  and that time has come!
data.author: General Peter Muhlenberg

data.quote: Prayer is often a temptation to bank on a miracle of God instead of on a moral issue  i.e.  it is much easier to ask God to do my work than it is to do it myself. Until we are disciplined properly  we will always be inclined to bank on God's miracles and refuse to do the moral thing ourselves. It is our job  and it will never be done unless we do it.
data.author: Oswald Chambers

data.quote: Some people think that prayer just means asking for things  and if they fail to receive exactly what they asked for  they think the whole thing is a fraud.
data.author: Gerald Vann

data.quote: Poverty  chastity  and obedience are extremely difficult. But there are always the graces if you will pray for them.
data.author: Katheryn Hulme

data.quote: Real prayer seeks an audience and an answer.
data.author: William S. Plumer

data.quote: There are three answers to prayer: yes  no  and wait awhile. It must be recognized that no is an answer.
data.author: Ruth Stafford Peale

data.quote: There are four ways God answers prayer: No  not yet  No  I love you too much  Yes  I thought you'd never ask  Yes  and here's more.
data.author: Anne Lewis

data.quote: No answer to prayer is an indication of our merit  every answer to prayer is an indication of God's mercy.
data.author: John Blanchard

data.quote: God answers all true prayer  either in kind or in kindness.
data.author: Adoniram Judson

data.quote: God is not a cosmic bellboy for whom we can press a button to get things.
data.author: Harry Emerson Fosdick

data.quote: More things are wrought by prayer than this world dreams of.
data.author: Alfred, Lord Tennyson

data.quote: When I have a problem I pray about it  and what comes to mind and stays there I assume to be my answer. And this has been right so often that I know it is God's answer.
data.author: J. L. Kraft

data.quote: Whenever the insistence is on the point that God answers prayer  we are off the track. The meaning of prayer is that we get hold of God  not of the answer.
data.author: Oswald Chambers

data.quote: I think Christians fail so often to get answers to their prayers because they do not wait long enough on God. They just drop down and say a few words  and then jump up and forget it and expect God to answer them. Such praying always reminds me of the small boy ringing his neighbor's door-bell  and then running away as fast as he can go.
data.author: E. M. Bounds

data.quote: When I pray  coincidences happen  and when I don't  they don't.
data.author: William Temple

data.quote: Our understanding of God is the answer to prayer  getting things from God is God's indulgence of us. When God stops giving us things  He brings us into the place where we can begin to understand Him.
data.author: Oswald Chambers

data.quote: If God sees that my spiritual life will be furthered by giving the things for which I ask  then He will give them  but that is not the end of prayer. The end of prayer is that I come to know God Himself.
data.author: Oswald Chambers

data.quote: You say  "But He has not answered." He has  He is so near to you that His silence is the answer. His silence is big with terrific meaning that you cannot understand yet  but presently you will.
data.author: Oswald Chambers

data.quote: When we pray "in the Name of Jesus" the answers are in accordance with His nature  and if we think our prayers are unanswered it is because we are not interpreting the answer along this line.
data.author: Oswald Chambers

data.quote: God's silences are His answers. If we only take as answers those that are visible to our senses  we are in a very elementary condition of grace.
data.author: Oswald Chambers

data.quote: Who rises from prayer a better man  his prayer is answered.
data.author: George Meredith

data.quote: God has editing rights over our prayers. He will... edit them  correct them  bring them in line with His will and then hand them back to us to be resubmitted.
data.author: Stephen Crotts

data.quote: The great tragedy of life is not unanswered prayer  but unoffered prayer.
data.author: KB. Meyer

data.quote: My prayers  my God  flow from what I am not  I think Thy answers make me what I am.
data.author: George Macdonald

data.quote: The greatest blessing of prayer is not receiving the answer  but being the kind of person God can trust with His answer.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: God answers prayer with certainty. Wish fulfillment is something else.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: God delays  but doesn't forget.
data.author: Spanish proverb

data.quote: A generous prayer is never presented in vain  the petition may be refused  but the petitioner is always  I believe  rewarded by some gracious visitation.
data.author: Robert Louis Stevenson

data.quote: I tremble for my country when I reflect that God is just.
data.author: Thomas Jefferson

data.quote: The answer of our prayers is secured by the fact that in rejecting them God would in a certain sense deny His own nature.
data.author: John Calvin

data.quote: There are two main pitfalls on the road to mastery of the art of prayer. If a person gets what he asks for  his humility is in danger. If he fails to get what he asks for  he is apt to lose confidence. Indeed  no matter whether prayer seems to be succeeding or failing  humility and confidence are two virtues which are absolutely essential.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: If we be empty and poor  it is not because God's hand is straitened  but ours is not opened.
data.author: Thomas Manton

data.quote: I firmly believe a great many prayers are not answered because we are not willing to forgive someone.
data.author: Dwight L. Moody

data.quote: I know not by what methods rare  But this I know: God answers prayer. I know not if the blessing sought Will come in just the guise I thought. I leave my prayer to Him alone Whose will is wiser than my own.
data.author: Eliza M. Hickok

data.quote: Our prayers are often filled with selfish "wants"  God always answers with what we need.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: We ought not to tolerate for a minute the ghastly and grievous thought that God will not answer prayer.
data.author: Charles Haddon Spurgeon

data.quote: Though I am weak  yet God  when prayed  Cannot withhold his conquering aid.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: Beyond our utmost wants His love and power can bless  To praying souls he always grants More than they can express.
data.author: John Newton

data.quote: Whatever things ye desire  when ye pray  believe that you receive them  and ye shall have them.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: The firmament of the Bible is ablaze with answers to prayer.
data.author: T. L. Cuyler

data.quote: Never was a faithful prayer lost. Some prayers have a longer voyage than others  but then they return with their richer lading at last  so that the praying soul is a gainer by waiting for an answer.
data.author: William Gurnall

data.quote: In Gethsemane the holiest of all petitioners prayed three times that a certain cup might pass from Him. It did not. After that the idea that prayer is recommended to us as a sort of infallible gimmick may be dismissed.
data.author: C. S. Lewis

data.quote: Sometimes ... God answers our prayers in the way our parents do  who reply to the pleas of their children with "Not just now" or "I'll have to think about that for a little while."
data.author: Roy M. Pearson

data.quote: Answered prayers cover the field of providential history as flowers cover western prairies.
data.author: T. L. Cuyler

data.quote: In seasons of distress and grief  My soul has often found relief  And oft escaped the tempter's snare  By thy return  sweet hour of prayer.
data.author: W. W. Walford

data.quote: God answers sharp and sudden on some prayers  And thrusts the thing we have prayed for in our face. A gauntlet with a gift in't.
data.author: Elizabeth Barrett Browning

data.quote: Our prayers run along one road and God's answers by another  and by and by they meet.
data.author: Adoniram Judson

data.quote: God's chief gift to those who seek him is Himself.
data.author: E. B. Pusey

data.quote: Asking for anything is allowed with the understanding that God's answers come from God's perspective. They are not always in harmony with our expectations  for only He knows the whole story.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: May the Lord answer you when you are in distress  May the name of the God of Jacob protect you  May he send you help from the sanctuary and grant you support from Zion.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: Just when I need Him  He is my all  Answering when upon Him I call  Tenderly watching lest I should fall.
data.author: William Poole

data.quote: The king shall joy in thy strength  O Lord  and in thy salvation how greatly shall he rejoice! Thou hast given him his heart's desire  and hast not withheld the request of his lips.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: Those who trade with heaven by prayer grow rich by quick returns.
data.author: William S. Plumer

data.quote: The great thing in prayer is to feel that we are putting our supplications into the bosom of omnipotent love.
data.author: Andrew Murray

data.quote: When you go to your knees  God will help you stand up to anything.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Prayer has marked the trees across the wilderness of a skeptical world to direct the traveler in distress  and all paths lead to a single light.
data.author: Douglas Meador

data.quote: Amazing things start happening when we start praying!
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Prayer enlarges the heart until it is capable of containing God's gift of Himself.
data.author: Mother Teresa

data.quote: The man who prays grows  and the muscles of the soul swell from this whipcord to iron bands.
data.author: F. B. Meyer

data.quote: Prayer opens our eyes that we may see ourselves and others as God sees us.
data.author: Clara Palmer

data.quote: It is impossible to lose your footing while on your knees.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: The exercise of prayer  in those who habitually exert it  must be regarded by us doctors as the most adequate and normal of all the pacifiers of the mind and calmers of the nerves.
data.author: William James

data.quote: The influence of prayer on the human mind and body ... can be measured in terms of increased physical buoyancy  greater intellectual vigor  moral stamina  and a deeper understanding of the realities underlying human relationships.
data.author: Dr. Alexis Carrel

data.quote: The essence of prayer  even of a mystical experience  is the way we are altered to see everything from its life-filled dimension.
data.author: Matthew Fox

data.quote: Prayer puts God's work in His hands-and keeps it there.
data.author: E. M. Bounds

data.quote: It is hard to wait and press and pray  and hear no voice  but stay till God answers.
data.author: E. M. Bounds

data.quote: Prayer is a kind of calling home every day. And there can come to you a serenity  a feeling of at-homeness in God's universe  a peace that the world can neither give nor disturb  a fresh courage  a new insight  a holy boldness that you'll never  never get any other way.
data.author: Earl G. Hunt

data.quote: Pray because you have a Father  not because it quietens you  and give Him time to answer.
data.author: Oswald Chambers

data.quote: Perhaps one of the greatest rewards of meditation and prayer is the sense of belonging that comes to us.
data.author: Bill W.

data.quote: We impoverish God in our minds when we say there must be answers to our prayers on the material plane  the biggest answers to our prayers are in the realm of the unseen.
data.author: Oswald Chambers

data.quote: Our Lord never referred to unanswered prayer  he taught that prayers are always answered. He ever implied that prayers were answered rightly because of the Heavenly Father's wisdom.
data.author: Oswald Chambers

data.quote: As white snow flakes fall quietly and thickly on a winter day  answers to prayer will settle down upon you at every step you take  even to your dying day. The story of your life will be the story of prayer and answers to prayer.
data.author: O. Hallesby

data.quote: God is a rich and bountiful Father  and He does not forget His children  nor withhold from them anything which it would be to their advantage to receive.
data.author: J. K. Maclean

data.quote: Just as an earthly father knows what is best for his children's welfare  so does God take into consideration the particular needs of His human family  and meets them out of His wonderful storehouse.
data.author: J. K. Maclean

data.quote: Prayer brings a good spirit in our homes. For God hears prayer. Heaven itself would come down to our homes. And even though we who constitute the home all have our imperfections and our failings  our home would  through God's answer to prayer  become a little paradise.
data.author: O. Hallesby

data.quote: God's willingness to answer our prayers exceeds our willingness to give good and necessary things to our children  just as far as God's ability  goodness and perfection exceed our infirmities and evil.
data.author: E. M. Bounds

data.quote: The greatest answer to prayer is that I am brought into a perfect understanding with God  and that alters my view of actual things.
data.author: Oswald Chambers

data.quote: God's "nothings" are His most positive answers. We have to stay on God and wait. Never try to help God to fulfill His word.
data.author: Oswald Chambers

data.quote: The shower of answers to your prayers will continue to your dying hour. Nor will it cease then. When you pass out from beneath the shower  your dear ones will step into it. Every prayer and every sigh which you have uttered for them and their future welfare will  in God's time  descend upon them as a gentle rain of answers to prayer.
data.author: O. Hallesby

data.quote: If a door slams shut it means that God is pointing to an open door further on down.
data.author: Anna Delaney Peale

data.quote: We  ignorant of ourselves  beg often our own harms  which the wise powers deny us for our good.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: Prayer is the easiest and hardest of all things  the simplest and the sublim-est  the weakest and the most powerful  its results lie outside the range of human possibilities-they are limited only by the omnipotence of God.
data.author: E. M. Bounds

data.quote: Prayer  like faith  obtains promises  enlarges their operation  and adds to the measure of their results.
data.author: E. M. Bounds

data.quote: If we will make use of prayer to call down upon ourselves and others those things which will glorify the name of God  then we shall see the strongest and boldest promises of the Bible about prayer fulfilled. Then we shall see such answers to prayer as we had never thought were possible.
data.author: O. Hallesby

data.quote: Let it be your business every day  in the secrecy of the inner chamber  to meet the holy God. You will be repaid for the trouble it may cost you. The reward will be sure and rich.
data.author: Andrew Murray

data.quote: One great effect of prayer is that it enables the soul to command the body. By obedience I make my body submissive to my soul  but prayer puts my soul in command of my body.
data.author: Oswald Chambers

data.quote: If we pray for anything according to the will of God  we already have what we pray for the moment we ask it. We do not know exactly when it will arrive  but we have learned to know God through the Spirit of God  and have learned to leave this in His hands  and to live just as happily whether the answer arrives immediately or later.
data.author: O. Hallesby

data.quote: It is God's will not only to hear our prayer  but to give us the best and the richest answer which He  the almighty and omniscient God  can devise. He will send us the answer when it will benefit us and His cause the most.
data.author: O. Hallesby

data.quote: If God does not give you something you ask for  wait on Him. He will speak with you tenderly and sympathetically about the matter until you yourself understand that He cannot grant your prayer.
data.author: O. Hallesby

data.quote: The potency of prayer hath subdued the strength of fire  it hath bridled the rage of lions  hushed anarchy to rest  extinguished wars  appeased the elements  expelled demons  burst the chains of death  expanded the gates of heaven  assuaged diseases  repelled frauds  rescued cities from destruction  stayed the sun in its course  and arrested the progress of the thunderbolt.
data.author: Saint John Chrysostom

data.quote: Be sure to remember that nothing in your daily life is so insignificant and so inconsequential that the Lord will not help you by answering your prayer.
data.author: O. Hallesby

data.quote: More tears are shed over answered prayers than unanswered ones.
data.author: Teresa of Avila

data.quote: True prayer always receives what it asks for-or something better.
data.author: Bryon Edwards

data.quote: Be thankful that God's answers are wiser than your answers.
data.author: William Culbertson

data.quote: God punishes us mildly by ignoring our prayers  and severely by answering them.
data.author: Richard J. Needham

data.quote: When the gods wish to punish us  they answer our prayers.
data.author: Oscar Wilde

data.quote: God alone fully understands what each one of us needs  we make mistakes continually and pray for things which would be harmful to us if we received them. Afterwards we see our mistakes and realize that God is good and wise in not giving us these things  even though we plead ever so earnestly for them.
data.author: O. Hallesby

data.quote: When the gods are angry with a man  they give him what he asks for.
data.author: Greek proverb

data.quote: I have lived to thank God that all my prayers have not been answered.
data.author: Jean Ingelow

data.quote: Prayer is the supreme activity of all that is noblest in our personality  and the essential nature of prayer is faith.
data.author: Oswald Chambers

data.quote: Prayer is the voice of faith.
data.author: William Van Home

data.quote: The prayer that is faithless is fruitless.
data.author: Thomas Watson

data.quote: A saint is to put forth his faith in prayer  and afterwards follow his prayer with faith.
data.author: Vavasor Powell

data.quote: The prayer of faith is the only power in the universe to which the great Jehovah yields.
data.author: Robert Hall

data.quote: Prayers are heard in heaven very much in proportion to your faith. Little faith will get very great mercies  but great faith still greater.
data.author: Charles Haddon Spurgeon

data.quote: The beginning of anxiety is the end of faith  and the beginning of true faith is the end of anxiety.
data.author: George Mueller

data.quote: Teach me  O God  not to torture myself  not to make a martyr out of myself through stifling reflection  but rather teach me to breathe deeply in faith.
data.author: Soren Kierkegaard

data.quote: Faith is the fountain of prayer  and prayer should be nothing else but faith exercised.
data.author: Thomas Manton

data.quote: Without faith it is impossible to please God  for he that cometh to God must believe that He is.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: When we pray we link ourselves with an inexhaustible motive power.
data.author: Dr. Alexis Carrel

data.quote: Jesus Christ is a God whom we approach without pride  and before whom we humble ourselves without despair.
data.author: Blaise Pascal

data.quote: Granting that we are always in the presence of God  yet it seems to me that those who pray are in His presence in a very different sense  for they  as it were  see that He is looking upon them  while others may go for days on end without even once recollecting that God sees them.
data.author: Teresa of Avila

data.quote: Why is it when we talk to God we're said to be praying  but when God talks to us we're schizophrenic?
data.author: Lily Tomlin

data.quote: It is in recognizing the actual presence of God that we find prayer no longer a chore  but a supreme delight.
data.author: Gordon Lindsay

data.quote: Essentially prayer is based on a relationship. We don't converse freely with someone we don't know. We bare our souls and disclose our hidden secrets only to someone we trust.
data.author: Dean Register

data.quote: I who still pray at morning and at eve Thrice in my life perhaps have truly prayed  Thrice stirred below conscious self Have felt that perfect disenthrallment which is God.
data.author: James Russell Lowell

data.quote: Prayer is the soul's breathing itself into the bosom of its heavenly Father.
data.author: Thomas Watson

data.quote: Prayer is a shield to the soul  a sacrifice to God  and a scourge for Satan.
data.author: John Bunyan

data.quote: Prayer is the spiritual gymnasium in which we exercise and practice godliness.
data.author: V. L. Crawford

data.quote: Prayer is exhaling the spirit of man and inhaling the spirit of God.
data.author: Edwin Keith

data.quote: Prayer is the acid test of devotion.
data.author: Samuel Chadwick

data.quote: Prayer serves as an edge and border to preserve the web of life from unraveling.
data.author: Robert Hall

data.quote: Prayer is the ascending vapor which supplies The showers of blessing  and the stream that flows Through earth's dry places  till on every side "The wilderness shall blossom as the rose."
data.author: A. B. Simpson

data.quote: Prayer is a rising up and a drawing near to God in mind and in heart  and in spirit.
data.author: Alexander Whyte

data.quote: Prayer means that we have come boldly into the throne room and we are standing in His presence.
data.author: E. W. Kenyon

data.quote: Prayer is the contemplation of the facts of life from the highest point of view.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: Prayer does not mean simply to pour out one's heart. It means rather to find the way to God and to speak with him  whether the heart is full or empty.
data.author: Dietrich Bonhoeffer

data.quote: Prayer is not an exercise  it is the life.
data.author: Oswald Chambers

data.quote: Prayer is our most formidable weapon  the thing which makes all else we do efficient.
data.author: E. M. Bounds

data.quote: Prayer is not logical  it is a mysterious moral working of the Holy Spirit.
data.author: Oswald Chambers

data.quote: Prayer should be the means by which I  at all times  receive all that I need  and  for this reason  be my daily refuge  my daily consolation  my daily joy  my source of rich and inexhaustible joy in life.
data.author: Saint John Chrysostom

data.quote: Prayer is the spirit speaking truth to Truth.
data.author: Philip James Bailey

data.quote: Prayer is a cry of distress  a demand for help  a hymn of love.
data.author: Dr. Alexis Carrel

data.quote: Prayer  in its simplest definition  is merely a wish turned God-ward.
data.author: Phillips Brooks

data.quote: Prayer is the evidence that I am spiritually concentrated on God.
data.author: Oswald Chambers

data.quote: Prayer is the pillow of religion.
data.author: Arab proverb

data.quote: Prayer is God's answer to our poverty  not a power we exercise to obtain an answer.
data.author: Oswald Chambers

data.quote: Prayer is a condition of mind  an attitude of heart  which God recognizes as prayer whether it manifests itself in quiet thinking  in sighing or in audible words.
data.author: O. Hallesby

data.quote: Prayer is an all-efficient panoply  a treasure undiminished  a mine which is never exhausted  a sky unobscured by clouds  a heaven unruffled by the storm. It is the root  the fountain  the mother of a thousand blessings.
data.author: Saint John Chrysostom

data.quote: Some pray to marry the man they love  my prayer will somewhat vary  I humbly pray to Heaven above that I love the man I marry.
data.author: Rose Pastor Stokes

data.quote: The prayers of the Christian are secret  but their effect cannot be hidden.
data.author: Howard Chandler Robbins

data.quote: Man is the only creature which rises by bowing  for he finds elevation in his subjection to his Maker.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Lord  till I reach that blissful shore  No privilege so dear shall be As thus my inmost soul to pour In prayer to thee.
data.author: Charlotte Elliott

data.quote: Revival fires flame where hearts are praying.
data.author: Dick Eastman

data.quote: If we could all hear one another's prayers  God might be relieved of some of his burden.
data.author: Ashleigh Brilliant

data.quote: What I dislike least in my former self are the moments of prayer.
data.author: Andre Gide

data.quote: Our rages  daughters of despair  creep and squirm like worms. Prayer is the only form of revolt which remains upright.
data.author: Georges Bernanos

data.quote: Prayer reaches out in love to a dying world and says  "I care."
data.author: Dick Eastman

data.quote: To pray together  in whatever tongue or ritual  is the most tender brotherhood of hope and sympathy that man can contract in this life.
data.author: Madame de Stael

data.quote: The deepest wishes of the heart find expression in secret prayer.
data.author: George E. Rees

data.quote: We are never more like Christ than in prayers of intercession.
data.author: Austin Phelps

data.quote: The spirit of prayer is the fruit and token of the Spirit of adoption.
data.author: John Newton

data.quote: If we do not love one another  we certainly shall not have much power with God in prayer.
data.author: Dwight L. Moody

data.quote: Keep us  Lord  so awake in the duties of our calling that we may sleep in thy peace and wake in thy glory.
data.author: John Donne

data.quote: I find in the Psalms much the same range of mood and expression as I perceive within my own life of prayer.
data.author: Malcolm Boyd

data.quote: I am used to praying when I am alone  thank God. But when I come together with other people  when I need more than ever to pray  I still cannot get used to it.
data.author: Leo Tolstoy

data.quote: Nothing is discussed more and practiced less than prayer.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: I always love to begin a journey on Sundays  because I shall have the prayers of the church to preserve all that travel by land  or by water.
data.author: Jonathan Swift

data.quote: Nor it is an objection to say that we must understand a prayer if it is to have its true effect. That simply is not the case. Who understands the wisdom of a flower? Yet we can take pleasure in it.
data.author: Rudolph Steiner

data.quote: I would rather stand against the cannons of the wicked than against the prayers of the righteous.
data.author: Thomas Lye

data.quote: Restraining prayer  we cease to fight  Prayer keeps the Christian's armor bright  And Satan trembles when he sees The weakest saint upon his knees.
data.author: William Cowper

data.quote: God dwells where we let God in.
data.author: Menachem Mendel

data.quote: Courage is not afraid to weep  and she is not afraid to pray  even when she is not sure who she is praying to.
data.author: J. Ruth Gendler

data.quote: Saints of the early church reaped great harvests in the field of prayer and found the mercy seat to be a mine of untold treasures.
data.author: Charles Haddon Spurgeon

data.quote: At church  with meek and unaffected grace  His looks adorn'd the venerable place  Truth from his lips prevail'd with double sway  And fools who came to scoff  remain'd to pray.
data.author: Oliver Goldsmith

data.quote: The wings of prayer carry high and far.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: In the calm of sweet communion Let thy daily work be done  In the peace of soul-outpouring Care be banished  patience won  And if earth with its enchantments Seek thy spirit to enthrall  Ere thou listen  ere thou answer  Turn to Jesus  tell Him all.
data.author: G. M. Taylor

data.quote: God warms his hands at man's heart when he prays.
data.author: John Masefield

data.quote: Turn your doubts to question  turn your question to prayers  turn your prayers to God.
data.author: Mark R. Litteton

data.quote: Prayer  like radium  is a luminous and self-generating form of energy.
data.author: Dr. Alexis Carrel

data.quote: Whatever you do in revenge against your brother will appear all at once in your heart at the time of payer.
data.author: The Desert Fathers

data.quote: Any concern too small to be turned into a prayer is too small to be made into a burden.
data.author: Corrie ten Boom

data.quote: Never say you will pray about a thing  pray about it.
data.author: Oswald Chambers

data.quote: Doubt not but God who sits on high  Thy secret prayers can hear  When a dead wall thus cunningly Conveys soft whispers to the ear.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: The granting of prayer  when offered in the name of Jesus  reveals the Father's love to him  and the honor which he has put upon him.
data.author: Charles Haddon Spurgeon

data.quote: A prayer  in its simplest definition  is merely a wish turned heavenward.
data.author: Phillips Brooks

data.quote: They never sought in vain that sought the Lord aright!
data.author: James Drummond Burns

data.quote: Prayer is the voice of faith.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Prayer is not to be used as a confessional  to cancel sin. Such an error would impede true religion. Sin is forgiven only as it is destroyed by Christ - Truth and Light.
data.author: Mary Baker Eddy

data.quote: You pray in your distress and in your need  would that you might pray also in the fullness of your joy and in your days of abundance.
data.author: Kahlil Gibran

data.quote: At church  with meek and unaffected grace  His looks adorn'd the venerable place  Truth from his lips prevailed with double sway  And fools  who came to scoff  remain'd to pray.
data.author: Oliver Goldsmith

data.quote: He that will learn to pray  let him go to Sea.
data.author: George Edward Herbert

data.quote: O God  if in the day of battle I forget Thee  do not Thou forget me.
data.author: William King

data.quote: If I am right  Thy grace impart  Still in the right to stay  If I am wrong  O teach my heart To find that better way!
data.author: Alexander Pope

data.quote: Our Father  which art in heaven  Hallowed be thy Name. Thy kingdom come. Thy will be done in earth as it is in heaven. Give us this day our daily bread. And forgive us our debts  as we forgive our debtors. And lead us not into temptation  but deliver us from evil: For thine is the kingdom and the power and the glory  for ever. Amen.
data.author: Matthew

data.quote: God warms his hands at man's heart when he prays.
data.author: John Masefield

data.quote: Every one that asketh receiveth  and he that seeketh findeth.
data.author: Matthew

data.quote: Our prayers should be for blessings in general  for God knows best what is good for us.
data.author: Socrates

data.quote: Ask  and it shall be given you  seek and ye shall find  knock  and it shall be opened unto you.
data.author: Matthew

data.quote: Pray as if everything depended on God  and work as if everything depended upon man.
data.author: Francis Cardinal Spellman

data.quote: Give us the strength to encounter that which is to come  that we may be brave in peril  constant in tribulation  temperate in wrath  and in all changes of fortune  and down to the gates of death  loyal and loving one to anther.
data.author: Robert Louis Stevenson

data.quote: The Christian ministry is the worst of all trades  but the best of all professions.
data.author: John Newton

data.quote: Do as we say  and not as we do.
data.author: Giovanni Boccaccio

data.quote: Alas for the unhappy man that is called to stand in the pulpit  and not give the bread of life.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: I would have every minister of the gospel address his audience with the zeal of a friend  with the generous energy of a father  and with the exuberant affection of a mother.
data.author: Francois Fenelon

data.quote: The test of a preacher is that his congregation goes away saying  not What a lovely sermon  but  I will do something!
data.author: St. Francis de Sales

data.quote: But in his duty prompt at every call  He watch'd and wept  he pray'd and felt for all.
data.author: Oliver Goldsmith

data.quote: Sir  a woman preaching is like a dog's walking on his hind legs. It is not done well: but you are surprised to find it done at all.
data.author: Samuel Johnson

data.quote: Some plague the people with too long sermons  for the faculty of listening is a tender thing  and soon becomes weary and satiated.
data.author: Martin Luther

data.quote: I have taught you  my dear flock  for above thirty years how to live  and I will show you in a very short time how to die.
data.author: George Sandys

data.quote: Sermons in stones and good in every thing.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: Preach the word  be instant in season  out of season  reprove  rebuke  exhort with all long suffering and doctrine.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: The minister's brain is often die "poor-box" of the church.
data.author: Henry B. Whipple

data.quote: An antisemite is a person who hates Jews more than is absolutely necessary.
data.author: Jewish proverb

data.quote: I am 52 years of age. I am a bishop in the Anglican Church  and a few people might be constrained to say that I was reasonably responsible. In the land of my birth  I cannot vote.
data.author: Bishop Desmond Tutu

data.quote: I never believed in Santa Claus because I knew no white dude would come into my neighbourhood after dark.
data.author: Dick Gregory

data.quote: It is a great shock at the age of 5 or 6 to find that in a world of Gary Coopers you are the Indian.
data.author: James Baldwin

data.quote: Never try to reason the prejudice out of a man. It was not reasoned into him  and cannot be reasoned out.
data.author: Sydney Smith

data.quote: Since my little daughter is only half Jewish  would it be alright if she went into the pool only up to her waist?
data.author: Groucho Marx

data.quote: There are only two ways to be quite unprejudiced and impartial. One is to be completely ignorant. The other is to be completely indifferent.
data.author: Charles Curtis

data.quote: Prejudice is the child of ignorance.
data.author: William Hazlitt

data.quote: Passion and prejudice govern the world  only under the name of reason.
data.author: John Wesley

data.quote: How it infuriates a bigot  when he is forced to drag out his dark convictions!
data.author: Logan Pearsall Smith

data.quote: Everyone is a prisoner of his own experiences. No one can eliminate prejudices - just recognize them.
data.author: Edward R. Murrow

data.quote: We are chameleons  and our partialities and prejudices change places with an easy and blessed facility.
data.author: Mark Twain

data.quote: Fortunately for serious minds  a bias recognized is a bias sterilized.
data.author: A. Eustace Haydon

data.quote: Without the aid of prejudice and custom  I should not be able to find my way across the room.
data.author: William Hazlitt

data.quote: One may no more live in the world without picking up the moral prejudices of the world than one will be able to go to hell without perspiring.
data.author: H. L. Mencken

data.quote: We hate some persons because we do not know them  and will not know them because we hate them.
data.author: Charles Caleb Colton

data.quote: The mind of a bigot is like the pupil of the eye  the more light you pour upon it  the more it will contract.
data.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

data.quote: It is not healthy when a nation lives within a nation  as coloured Americans are living inside America. A nation cannot live confident of its tomorrow if its refugees are among its own citizens.
data.author: Pearl Buck

data.quote: Of all the injuries inflicted by racism on people of colour  the most corrosive is the wound within  the internalized racism that leads some victims  at unspeakable cost to their own sense of self  to embrace the values of their oppressors.
data.author: H. Jack Geiger

data.quote: He hears but half who hears one party only.
data.author: Aeschylus

data.quote: A fox should not be of the jury at a goose's trial.
data.author: Thomas Fuller

data.quote: He who never leaves his country is full of prejudices.
data.author: Carlo Goldoni

data.quote: Prejudice is the child of ignorance.
data.author: William Hazlitt

data.quote: Opinions founded on prejudice are always sustained with the greatest violence.
data.author: Lord Francis Jeffrey

data.quote: To lead an untrained people to war is to throw them away.
data.author: Confucius

data.quote: In fair weather prepare for foul.
data.author: Thomas Fuller

data.quote: We should lay up in peace what we shall need in war.
data.author: Syrus

data.quote: To be prepared for war is one of the most effectual means of preserving peace.
data.author: George Washington

data.quote: If you are as happy  my dear sir  on entering this house as I am in leaving it and returning home  you are the happiest man in this country.
data.author: George Buchanan

data.quote: I would rather be right than President.
data.author: Henry Clay

data.quote: No man will ever bring out of the Presidency the reputation which carries him into it.
data.author: Thomas Jefferson

data.quote: If forced to choose between the penitentiary and the White House for four years  I would say the penitentiary  thank you.
data.author: William Tecumseh Sherman

data.quote: They pick a President and then for four years they pick on him.
data.author: Adlai Stevenson

data.quote: My movements to the chair of government will be accompanied by feelings not unlike those of a culprit who is going to the place of his execution.
data.author: George Washington

data.quote: Congress shall make no law abridging the freedom of speech or of the press.
data.author: Constitution of the United States

data.quote: Our liberty depends on the freedom of the press  and that cannot be limited without being lost.
data.author: Thomas Jefferson

data.quote: The freedom of the press is one of the great bulwarks of liberty and can never be restrained but by despotic governments.
data.author: George Mason

data.quote: Freedom of conscience  of education  of speech  of assembly are among the very fundamentals of democracy and all of them would be nullified should freedom of the press ever be successfully challenged.
data.author: F. D. Roosevelt

data.quote: Freedom of the press is the staff of life  for any vital democracy.
data.author: Wendell L. Willkie

data.quote: You must stir it and stump it  and blow your own trumpet  or trust me  you haven't a chance.
data.author: W. S. Gilbert

data.quote: Pride is seldom delicate: it will please itself with very mean advantages.
data.author: Samuel Johnson

data.quote: The truly proud man is satisfied with his own good opinion  and does not seek to make converts to it.
data.author: William Hazlitt

data.quote: Pride is the mask of one's own faults.
data.author: Jewish proverb

data.quote: Pride is the direct appreciation of oneself.
data.author: Arthur Schopenhauer

data.quote: There is a certain noble pride  through which merits shine brighter than through modesty.
data.author: Jean Paul Richter

data.quote: The sun will set without thy assistance.
data.author: The Talmud

data.quote: When a proud man hears another praised  he feels himself injured.
data.author: English proverb

data.quote: A confessional passage has probably never been written that didn't stink a little bit of the writer's pride in having given up his pride.
data.author: J. D. Salinger

data.quote: I do not believe that any peacock envies another peacock his tail  because every peacock is persuaded that his own tail is the finest in the world. The consequence of this is that peacocks are peaceable birds.
data.author: Bertrand Russell

data.quote: Pride  perceiving humility honourable  often borrows her cloak.
data.author: Thomas Fuller

data.quote: There is a paradox in pride: it makes some men ridiculous  but prevents others from becoming so.
data.author: Charles Caleb Colton

data.quote: Pride had rather go out of the way than go behind.
data.author: Thomas Fuller
